message_1: If p is a prime number and a is any positive integer such that p does not divide a, then what is the remainder when a^(p-1) is divided by p?
message_2:
According to Fermat's Little Theorem, if p is a prime number and a is any positive integer such that p does not divide a, then a^(p-1) is congruent to 1 modulo p. In other words:

a^(p-1) â‰¡ 1 (mod p)

This means that when a^(p-1) is divided by p, the remainder is 1.
